sorcer.service

Interface Link

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ContextLink

    public interface Link
extends Serializable
    The Link interface allows path values of service contexts to be linked to other service contexts using instances implementing this interface. The interface provides for service dataContext linking. Context links are references to an offset (path) in a dataContext, which allows the reuse of existing service dataContext objects.
    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getName()
      Returns a name of this link.
      String getOffset()
      Returns the path offset into this linked dataContext.
      boolean isFetched()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the linked contexed is retrived from a persitent dataContext storage into this link - true indicating if the linked contexed is already fetched; false otherwise.
      void isFetched(boolean state)
      Assignes a boolean indicating whether the linked contexed is retrived from a persitent dataContext storage into this link.
      boolean isLocal()
      Returns true if the linked dataContext associated with this link is enclosed into the link, otherwise false.
      void setContext(Context ctxt)
      Assignes a link service dataContext associated with this link.
      void setName(String name)
      Assign a link name for its linked dataContext.
      void setOffset(String offset)
      Sets the offset in this linked dataContext.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns a name of this link.
        Returns:
        a link name

      • setName

        void setName(String name)
        Assign a link name for its linked dataContext.
        Parameters:
        name - a name for this dataContext link

      • getOffset

        String getOffset()
        Returns the path offset into this linked dataContext.
        Returns:
        an offset of this link

      • setOffset

        void setOffset(String offset)
               throws ContextException
        Sets the offset in this linked dataContext. If the offset itself is obtained by traversing a link (meaning there is a redundant link), the offset is recalculated and the link object is reset to point to the owning dataContext (removing the redundancy).
        Parameters:
        offset -
        Throws:
        ContextException

      • setContext

        void setContext(Context ctxt)
        Assignes a link service dataContext associated with this link.
        Parameters:
        ctxt -

      • isLocal

        boolean isLocal()
        Returns true if the linked dataContext associated with this link is enclosed into the link, otherwise false.
        Returns:
        true if the linked dataContext is enclosed in this link

      • isFetched

        boolean isFetched()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the linked contexed is retrived from a persitent dataContext storage into this link - true indicating if the linked contexed is already fetched; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the linked contexed is already fetched

      • isFetched

        void isFetched(boolean state)
        Assignes a boolean indicating whether the linked contexed is retrived from a persitent dataContext storage into this link.
        Parameters:
        state - true indicating if the linked contexed is already fetched; false otherwise
